Title: Twenty Years Is Nothing
Description: In a previous edition of this magazine, we argued that English was so pervasive in our industry, nobody even questioned its use anymore. The same can be said of Git. It is difficult to imagine that merely twenty years ago, the landscape of source control tools was more diverse, and the choice of one such tool was much more complicated than today. Actually, Git was not even on the map yet. Before debating whether the hegemony of Git is good or bad, let us go back in time for a little while.

Title: Everything You Need to Know About Python - DeriveIt
Description: Here are all the import Python language features you need to know. -- Basics These are all the built-in data structure types in Python: `` primitives x = 1 integer x = 1.2 float x = True bool x = None null x = float('inf') infinity (float) objects x = [1, 2, 3] list x = (1, 2, 3) tuple x = 1: "a" dict x = 1, 2, 3 set x = "abc123" str `` You can convert between types like this: `` n = 7 str(n) '7' int('7') 7 x = [1,2,3] set(x) 1,2,3 tuple(x) (1,2,3) s = 1,2,3 list(s) [3,1,2], sets don't store ord

Title: Beyond Foreign Keys
Description: In a relational database, foreign keys are normally used to associate records stored in different tables, but wouldn’t it be nice to define relationships dynamically without having to add extra columns or tables? And while we’re at it, how about having sparse relationships by associating a record directly with any other record like “post X was last edited by user #123” or “post X was flagged for review by user #456” (who happens to be a moderator)?

Loss of integrity

Title: Reject minimalism
Description:
You’ve heard this one, I’m sure: Buy experiences, not things. Have you noticed how it’s always delivered with more than a hint of smug condescension? How it always seems to be a value judgment on the way you live your life?
It seems to me that the advice is almost always coming from two types of people: the extroverted, or the terminally online. The extrovert wants you to travel. Travel is the magic panacea to all of life’s problems.

Title: Connecting Your Windows and Uno Platform App to ChatGPT with Azure.AI.OpenAI - Nick's .NET Travels

In this blog post, we’ll guide you through the process of connecting your Windows app to ChatGPT using the Microsoft Azure.AI.OpenAI library, allowing you ... Read more

Title: Home · thmsmlr
Description:
One thing is certain in life: if you’re getting something for a steal, someone
is getting screwed, and it’s probably you elsewhere. This isn’t an
anti-capitalist rant, it’s just the truth. Companies don’t exist if they don’t
make money. Unless there’s some innovation, rest assured that you’re overpaying
somewhere else.
